definition: epoch-marking
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
surname Shi
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Cathay by Ezra Pound is an epoch-making masterpiece in the history of modern poetry in the west.
sentences.chinese: 龐德的《華夏集》是西方現代詩歌史上劃時代的作品。

sentences.english: The creation of the UN is an epoch-making event in human history.
sentences.chinese: 這是人類歷史上具有劃時代意義的創舉。

sentences.english: The “great convergence” is an epoch-making transformation.
sentences.chinese: “大趨同”是一個劃時代的轉變。

sentences.english: This led to the next epochal shift.
sentences.chinese: 這導致了下一個劃時代的轉變。

sentences.english: Fill a blank in China, he is the oil age epoch-making progress.
sentences.chinese: 填補了國內空白，他是濾油時代的劃時代的進步。

sentences.english: It was meant to sound like an epoch-making declaration.
sentences.chinese: 有意讓它聽起來像是一個劃時代的宣言。

sentences.english: In the history of Chinese poem, Hu Shi's A Collection of Attempting Modern Langnage Poem is a sign of new era.
sentences.chinese: 在我國詩歌史上，胡適《嘗試集》是劃時代的標誌。

sentences.english: The imperial examination system in the Tang Dynasty left a cross-age impact on the intellectual selection in China.
sentences.chinese: 唐代科舉制度在中國選士制度史上有着劃時代的意義。

sentences.english: The emergence of blue and white porcelain is of epoch-making significance in porcelain history.
sentences.chinese: 青花瓷的出現，在陶瓷史上具有劃時代的意義。

sentences.english: Then, who will become the anti-aging revolution in the history of the epoch-making messenger?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，誰將成爲這場抗衰老史上劃時代革命的信使呢？

sentences.english: In 1964 for post - war Japan was the epoch-making year.
sentences.chinese: 1964年對戰後日本是具有劃時代意義的一年。

sentences.english: It was an epoch-making event in our history.
sentences.chinese: 在我們的歷史中它是個劃時代事件。

sentences.english: Its epoch-making merit was that it propounded the problem.
sentences.chinese: 他的劃時代的功績在於提出了這個任務。

sentences.english: The Sydney Opera House is the mother and father of all modern landmark buildings.
sentences.chinese: 悉尼歌劇院是現代社會所有劃時代建築物的先驅。

definition: innovative
pioneering work
to be published/to come out
historic significance
surveyor's pole/post (used for a landmark)/CL:根[gen1]/(fig.) goal/model/benchmark
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
axle/(fig.) central element/key element/axis (alliance of nations)
originality
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
inspiring/exciting/rousing
pet/favorite/darling
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
embryonic form/fledgling stage/prototype
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
